subject: Science
title: Neptune: The Windiest World
description: A micro-lesson that makes Neptune: The Windiest World usable.

hook.text: Neptune is the farthest planet from the Sun, yet it has the fastest winds.

buildup.text: Wind speeds reach 2,100 km/h â€” faster than the speed of sound on Earth.

discovery.text: Neptune was the first planet found by math before anyone saw it through a telescope.

twist.text: It radiates 2.6 times more heat than it receives from the Sun. Nobody knows why.

climax.text: Its moon Triton orbits backwards and may be a captured dwarf planet.

punchline.text: The farthest planet was discovered by a pencil, not a telescope.
